intro: Aspidium aculeatum var. biaristatum, commonly known as the broad-leafed water fern, is a variant of the common water fern native to wetland environments. It belongs to the family Pteridaceae and is characterized by its large, broad, and often lobed fronds. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soil, thriving in temperate climates. Its fronds are usually dark green and can reach lengths of up to 1 meter. This variant is notable for its distinctive leaf shape and is often used in ornamental gardening due to its aesthetic appeal.
